sentences.english: He lifted his T-shirt to expose a jagged scar across his chest.
sentences.chinese: 他撩起T恤衫，露出横贯胸部的锯齿状伤疤。

detailed_translations.english: to show something that is usually covered or hidden

name: extreme
trans: n. 极端；末端；最大程度；极端的事物
adj. 极端的；极度的；偏激的；尽头的

sentences.english: Extreme poverty still exists in many rural areas.
sentences.chinese: 许多农村地区仍处于赤贫状态。

sentences.english: extreme cold
sentences.chinese: 严寒

sentences.english: He had extreme difficulty getting hold of the ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 他费了极大的劲找配料。

detailed_translations.english: very great in degree
a situation, quality etc which is as great as it can possibly be – used especially when talking about two opposites

name: gather
trans: vt. 收集；收割；使…聚集；使…皱起

sentences.english: You two know each other, I gather.
sentences.chinese: 我想你们俩认识。

detailed_translations.english: to believe that something is true because of what you have seen or heard

sentences.english: One hypothesis is that the victim fell asleep while driving.
sentences.chinese: 一种假设是受害人开车时睡着了。

detailed_translations.english: an idea that is suggested as an explanation for something, but that has not yet been proved to be true

name: initial
trans: vt. 用姓名的首字母签名

sentences.english: an initial investment of £5,000
sentences.chinese: 5,000英镑的初始投资

sentences.english: The initial response has been encouraging.
sentences.chinese: 最初的反应情况很乐观。

detailed_translations.english: happening at the beginning
the first letter of someone’s first name

name: illustrate
trans: vt. 阐明，举例说明；图解

sentences.english: Let me give an example to illustrate the point.
sentences.chinese: 让我举个例子来说明这一点。

sentences.english: She illustrated her discussion with diagrams.
sentences.chinese: 她用图表来说明她的论述。

detailed_translations.english: to make the meaning of something clearer by giving examples

name: inevitable
trans: adj. 必然的，不可避免的

sentences.english: A further escalation of the crisis now seems inevitable.
sentences.chinese: 危机的进一步升级现在看来已不可避免。

detailed_translations.english: certain to happen and impossible to avoid

name: isolate
trans: vt. 使隔离；使孤立；使绝缘

sentences.english: The town was isolated by the floods.
sentences.chinese: 洪水使该镇与外界隔绝。

sentences.english: The US has sought to isolate Cuba both economically and politically.
sentences.chinese: 美国一直想在经济和政治上孤立古巴。

detailed_translations.english: to separate one person, group, or thing from other people or things

sentences.english: The state police are investigating the incident.
sentences.chinese: 州警察正调查此事。

sentences.english: The study investigates the impact of violent TV programming on children.
sentences.chinese: 该研究调查暴力电视节目对儿童的影响。

sentences.english: I heard a noise and went downstairs to investigate.
sentences.chinese: 我听见响声，就下楼去看个究竟。

detailed_translations.english: to try to find out the truth about something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem

name: investigative
trans: adj. 研究的；调查的；好调查的

sentences.english: ...an investigative reporter.
sentences.chinese: …一位新闻调查记者。

detailed_translations.english: work or activities that involve investigating something

name: integrate
trans: vi. 求积分；取消隔离；成为一体
vt. 使…完整；使…成整体；求…的积分；表示…的总和

sentences.english: These programs can be integrated with your existing software.
sentences.chinese: 这些程序能和你的已有的软件整合成一体。

detailed_translations.english: to combine two or more things so that they work together; to combine with sth else in this way

name: intense
trans: adj. 强烈的；紧张的；非常的；热情的

sentences.english: Young people today are under intense pressure to succeed.
sentences.chinese: 如今的年轻人面临要出人头地的巨大压力。

sentences.english: the intense heat of the desert
sentences.chinese: 沙漠的炽热

sentences.english: The pain was so intense I couldn’t sleep.
sentences.chinese: 疼得我都睡不着觉。

sentences.english: He took an intense interest in all religious matters.
sentences.chinese: 他对所有宗教事宜都很感兴趣。

sentences.english: a look of intense dislike
sentences.chinese: 极端厌恶的表情

sentences.english: The job demands intense concentration.
sentences.chinese: 这工作需要全神贯注。

detailed_translations.english: having a very strong effect or felt very strongly

sentences.english: They spoke good Spanish, and promised to interpret for me.
sentences.chinese: 他们西班牙语说得很好，答应替我翻译。

sentences.english: Freud’s attempts to interpret the meaning of dreams
sentences.chinese: 弗洛伊德对梦的含义的解析

detailed_translations.english: to translate spoken words from one language into another

name: instant
trans: adj. 立即的；紧急的；紧迫的

sentences.english: an instant success
sentences.chinese: 马到成功

sentences.english: a system that provides instant access to client information
sentences.chinese: 能立即查到客户信息的系统

sentences.english: The women took an instant dislike to one another.
sentences.chinese: 这些女人立刻就彼此厌恶起来。

sentences.english: The programme brought an instant response.
sentences.chinese: 节目立即引起了反响。

sentences.english: For an instant, Barney was tempted to flee.
sentences.chinese: 那一瞬间，巴尼很想逃走。

detailed_translations.chinese: 立即的； 紧急的； 可以速食的
detailed_translations.english: happening or produced immediately
An instant is an extremely short period of time

name: intensive
trans: adj. 加强的；集中的；透彻的；加强语气的

sentences.english: a one-week intensive course in English
sentences.chinese: 为期一周的英语强化课程

sentences.english: a day of intensive negotiations
sentences.chinese: 紧张谈判的一天

detailed_translations.english: involving a lot of activity, effort, or careful attention in a short period of time

name: intelligent
trans: adj. 智能的；聪明的；理解力强的

sentences.english: a group of highly intelligent (= very intelligent )students
sentences.chinese: 一组聪明异常的学生

sentences.english: Sontag was once famously described as the most intelligent woman in America.
sentences.chinese: 桑塔格曾被称为美国最聪明的女人，这是众人皆知的事。

detailed_translations.english: an intelligent person has a high level of mental ability and is good at understanding ideas and thinking clearly

name: literary
trans: adj. 文学的；书面的；精通文学的

sentences.english: a literary prize
sentences.chinese: 文学奖

detailed_translations.english: relating to literature

name: mechanism
trans: n. 机制；原理，途径；进程；机械装置；技巧

sentences.english: the brake mechanism
sentences.chinese: 刹车装置

sentences.english: a clock mechanism
sentences.chinese: 钟表机件

detailed_translations.english: part of a machine or a set of parts that does a particular job

name: nevertheless
trans: adv. 然而，不过；虽然如此

sentences.english: What you said was true. It was, nevertheless, a little unkind.
sentences.chinese: 你说的都是实话，只不过有点刻薄。

sentences.english: Although the market has been flat, residential property costs remain high. Nevertheless, the fall-off in demand has had an impact on resale values.
sentences.chinese: 尽管市场一直疲软，房价持续偏高。然而需求的减少还是对二手房价格产生了影响。

detailed_translations.english: You use nevertheless when saying something that contrasts with what has just been said.
in spite of a fact that you have just mentioned

sentences.english: These conditions no longer obtain.
sentences.chinese: 这些状况已不复存在。

detailed_translations.chinese: 通用， 流行； 存在
detailed_translations.english: if a situation, system, or rule obtains, it continues to exist
to get something that you want, especially through your own effort, skill, or work

name: proportion
trans: n. 比例，占比；部分；面积；均衡
vt. 使成比例；使均衡；分摊

sentences.english: A large proportion of the dolphins in that area will eventually die.
sentences.chinese: 那个地区的很大一部分海豚最终都会死去。

sentences.english: What’s the proportion of boys to girls in your class?
sentences.chinese: 你们班里男女生的比例是多少？

detailed_translations.english: a part of a number or an amount, considered in relation to the whole

sentences.english: the early pioneers of the Dakota territory
sentences.chinese: 达科他地区的早期拓荒者

detailed_translations.english: someone who is important in the early development of something, and whose work or ideas are later developed by other people
to be the first person to do, invent or use something

name: perceive
trans: vt. 察觉，感觉；理解；认知

sentences.english: That morning, he perceived a change in Franca’s mood.
sentences.chinese: 那天早上，他注意到弗兰卡情绪的变化。

sentences.english: Cats are not able to perceive colour.
sentences.chinese: 猫不能辨别颜色。

detailed_translations.english: to notice, see, or recognize something

name: predict
trans: vi. 作出预言；作预料，作预报

sentences.english: Sales were five percent lower than predicted.
sentences.chinese: 销售额比预期低5%。

sentences.english: As Liz had predicted , the rumours were soon forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 正如利兹所预料的，流言很快就被淡忘了。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something will happen, before it happens

name: pupil
trans: n. 学生；[解剖] 瞳孔；未成年人

sentences.english: About 20 pupils study music here.
sentences.chinese: 大约20名小学生在这里学习音乐。

sentences.english: staff and pupils
sentences.chinese: 教职员工和学生

sentences.english: a star pupil
sentences.chinese: 一名优秀的小学生

sentences.english: a third-grade pupil
sentences.chinese: 一名三年级小学生

detailed_translations.english: someone who is being taught, especially a child

name: preserve
trans: n. 保护区；禁猎地；加工成的食品
vt. 保存；保护；维持；腌；禁猎

sentences.english: We must encourage the planting of new trees and preserve our existing woodlands.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须鼓励栽种新树木，同时也要保护现有的林地。

detailed_translations.english: to save something or someone from being harmed or destroyed

sentences.english: Weather patterns have changed in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 气候模式近年已经发生了变化。

sentences.english: A general pattern began to emerge .
sentences.chinese: 一个总体模式开始显现。

sentences.english: Their descriptions seemed to follow a set pattern (= always develop in the same way ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的描述似乎依据固定的模式。

sentences.english: His behavior fits a pattern of violent acts.
sentences.chinese: 他的举动符合暴力行为的模式。

sentences.english: a dress pattern
sentences.chinese: 连衣裙的纸样

detailed_translations.english: the regular way in which something happens, develops, or is done

name: precise
trans: adj. 精确的；明确的；严格的

sentences.english: precise sales figures
sentences.chinese: 准确的销售数据

sentences.english: It was difficult to get precise information.
sentences.chinese: 很难得到确切的消息。

sentences.english: ‘She’s a lot older than you, isn’t she?’ ‘Fifteen years, to be precise .’
sentences.chinese: “她比你大很多，是不是？”“准确地说，大了15岁。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 精确的， 准确的； 严谨的
detailed_translations.english: precise information, details etc are exact, clear, and correct

name: phenomenon
trans: n. 现象；奇迹；杰出的人才

sentences.english: Homelessness is not a new phenomenon .
sentences.chinese: 无家可归已不是什么新现象。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens or exists in society, science, or nature, especially something that is studied because it is difficult to understand

name: propose
trans: vt. 建议；打算，计划；求婚

sentences.english: the changes currently proposed by the local planning authorities
sentences.chinese: 目前由地方规划局提议的改革

sentences.english: the proposed budget cuts
sentences.chinese: 所提出的预算削减

detailed_translations.english: to suggest something as a plan or course of action

name: primarily
trans: adv. 首先；主要地，根本上

sentences.english: The advertisement is aimed primarily at children.
sentences.chinese: 这则广告的对象主要是儿童。

detailed_translations.english: mainly

name: prior
trans: adj. 优先的；在先的，在前的

sentences.english: You do not need any prior knowledge of the subject.
sentences.chinese: 你无需事先具备该方面的知识。

sentences.english: Changes may not be made without the prior approval of the council.
sentences.chinese: 未经委员会事先同意，不得作出改变。

sentences.english: Vegetarian meals are provided by prior agreement.
sentences.chinese: 经事先协商可提供素食。

sentences.english: Some prior experience with the software is needed.
sentences.chinese: 要求事先熟悉这个软件。

detailed_translations.english: existing or arranged before something else or before the present situation

name: perception
trans: n. 知觉；[生理] 感觉；看法；洞察力；获取

sentences.english: And when they do, what do you think their perception will be?
sentences.chinese: 当他们这样做时，你觉得他们的知觉是怎样的？

detailed_translations.english: Perception is the recognition of things using your senses, especially the sense of sight

sentences.english: The new law restricts the sale of hand guns.
sentences.chinese: 新法规限制手枪的销售。

sentences.english: You may need to restrict access to certain files (= limit the number of people who can read them ) .
sentences.chinese: 某些档案可能需要限制查阅。

sentences.english: The agreement will restrict competition.
sentences.chinese: 这个协议将限制竞争。

sentences.english: The cramped living conditions severely restricted the children’s freedom to play.
sentences.chinese: 拥挤的居住条件严重限制了孩子们玩耍的自由。

detailed_translations.english: to limit or control the size, amount, or range of something

name: realistic
trans: adj. 现实的；现实主义的；逼真的；实在论的

sentences.english: It’s just not realistic to expect a promotion so soon.
sentences.chinese: 这么快就想升职根本不现实。

sentences.english: You need to be realistic about the amount you can do in a day.
sentences.chinese: 你对自己一天能完成多少工作量要现实一点。

detailed_translations.english: judging and dealing with situations in a practical way according to what is actually possible rather than what you would like to happen

name: reflect
trans: vt. 反映；反射，照出；表达；显示;反省

sentences.english: The drop in consumer spending reflects concern about the economy.
sentences.chinese: 消费支出的下降反映出人们对经济的担忧。

detailed_translations.english: if a person or a thing is reflected in a mirror, glass, or water, you can see an image of the person or thing on the surface of the mirror, glass, or water

name: reveal
trans: n. 揭露；暴露；门侧，窗侧
vt. 显示；透露；揭露；泄露

sentences.english: He may be prosecuted for revealing secrets about the security agency.
sentences.chinese: 他可能因泄露安全部门的机密而被起诉。

sentences.english: a test that can reveal a teacher’s hidden skills
sentences.chinese: 能够展现老师潜在技能的测试

detailed_translations.english: to make known something that was previously secret or unknown

sentences.english: These skills were passed on to subsequent generations.
sentences.chinese: 这些技能代代相传。

sentences.english: subsequent pages of the book
sentences.chinese: 接下去的书页

detailed_translations.english: happening or coming after something else

name: sustain
trans: vt. 维持；支撑，承担；忍受；供养；证实

sentences.english: He leant against her so heavily that she could barely sustain his weight.
sentences.chinese: 他重重地靠在她身上，让她几乎撑不住了。

sentences.english: Which planets can sustain life?
sentences.chinese: 哪些行星可以维持生命的存在？

detailed_translations.english: to hold up the weight of something

name: substance
trans: n. 物质；实质；资产；主旨

sentences.english: The leaves were covered with a strange sticky substance.
sentences.chinese: 树叶上覆着一层黏糊糊的怪东西。

sentences.english: The substance of his argument was that people on welfare should work.
sentences.chinese: 他论点的主旨是享受社会福利的人应该去工作。

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of solid, liquid, or gas

name: ultimate
trans: n. 终极；根本；基本原则
adj. 最终的；极限的；根本的

sentences.english: The ultimate outcome of the experiment cannot be predicted.
sentences.chinese: 试验的最后结果无法预测。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s ultimate aim is their main and most important aim, that they hope to achieve in the future

name: unique
trans: n. 独一无二的人或物
adj. 独特的，稀罕的；[数] 唯一的，独一无二的

sentences.english: Each person’s fingerprints are unique.
sentences.chinese: 每个人的指纹都是独一无二的。

detailed_translations.english: being the only one of its kind

name: vital
trans: adj. 至关重要的；生死攸关的；有活力的

sentences.english: The work she does is absolutely vital.
sentences.chinese: 她所做的工作至关重要。

sentences.english: It is vital to be honest with your children.
sentences.chinese: 对自己的孩子坦诚十分重要。

sentences.english: The tourist industry is of vital importance to the national economy.
sentences.chinese: 旅游业对国家的经济至关重要。

sentences.english: Richardson played a vital role in the team’s success.
sentences.chinese: 理查森对球队的成功起了极重要的作用。

sentences.english: The samples could give scientists vital information about long-term changes in the earth’s atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 这些样本可以给科学家提供关于地球大气长期变化的极其重要的资料。

detailed_translations.english: extremely important and necessary for something to succeed or exist

name: virtually
trans: adv. 事实上，几乎；实质上

sentences.english: Virtually all the children come to school by bus.
sentences.chinese: 几乎所有的孩子都乘公交车上学。

sentences.english: He was virtually unknown before running for office.
sentences.chinese: 他在参加竞选之前几乎不为人知。

detailed_translations.english: almost

name: vehicle
trans: n. [车辆] 车辆；工具；交通工具；运载工具；传播媒介；媒介物

sentences.english: a description of the stolen vehicle
sentences.chinese: 对被盗车辆的描述

sentences.english: Have you locked your vehicle?
sentences.chinese: 你锁车了吗？

detailed_translations.english: a machine with an engine that is used to take people or things from one place to another, such as a car, bus, or truck

name: visible
trans: n. 可见物；进出口贸易中的有形项目
adj. 明显的；看得见的；现有的；可得到的

sentences.english: The comet is visible to the naked eye (= can be seen without using special equipment ).
sentences.chinese: 这颗彗星肉眼看得见。

sentences.english: Check the plant for any visible signs of disease.
sentences.chinese: 检查一下植物是否有患病的迹象。

detailed_translations.english: something that is visible can be seen

name: abstract
trans: n. 摘要；抽象；抽象的概念
vt. 摘要；提取；使……抽象化；转移(注意力、兴趣等)；使心不在焉

sentences.english: By the age of seven, children are capable of thinking in abstract terms .
sentences.chinese: 儿童到了七岁就具有抽象思维的能力。

sentences.english: Human beings are the only creatures capable of abstract thought (=  thinking about ideas  ) .
sentences.chinese: 人类是唯一具有抽象思维能力的动物。

detailed_translations.english: based on general ideas or principles rather than specific examples or real events

detailed_translations.chinese: 摘要，梗概；抽象派艺术作品
detailed_translations.english: a painting, design etc which contains shapes or images that do not look like real things or people

name: anthropologist
trans: n. 人类学家；人类学者

sentences.english: This is something I learned as an anthropologist –people love to tell their stories.
sentences.chinese: 这是我作为一名人类学家所理解的----人们喜欢讲述自己的故事。

sentences.english: Fisher, a biological anthropologist, says she wrote her latest book because she wanted to uncover the science behind “why you love who you love and perhaps even help people find the one”.
sentences.chinese: 费舍尔，生物人类学家，说她的最新著作的出发点是缘于她想揭开“为什么你会爱上你的爱人，这也许会帮助人们找到爱人”背后的科学依据。

sentences.english: A data manager, media coordinator, and medical anthropologist will also be arriving over the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 一名数据管理员、媒体协调员和医学人类学家也将于周末抵达。

name: acceleration
trans: n. 加速，促进；[物] 加速度

sentences.english: an acceleration in the rate of inflation
sentences.chinese: 通货膨胀率的加快

detailed_translations.english: a process in which something happens more and more quickly

sentences.english: The hotel had a lovely relaxed atmosphere .
sentences.chinese: 那家宾馆的气氛轻松愉快。

sentences.english: The atmosphere at home was rather tense.
sentences.chinese: 家里的气氛很紧张。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that an event or place gives you

name: artefact
trans: n. 工艺品；人工制品，加工品

sentences.english: ancient Egyptian artefacts
sentences.chinese: 古埃及手工艺品

detailed_translations.chinese: 人工制品， 手工艺品
detailed_translations.english: an object such as a tool, weapon etc that was made in the past and is historically important

sentences.english: an abundance of wavy red hair
sentences.chinese: 浓密的红色鬈发

sentences.english: One quality the team possessed in abundance was fighting spirit.
sentences.chinese: 该队的一大特点是斗志昂扬。

detailed_translations.english: a large quantity of something

name: appreciate
trans: vt. 欣赏；感激；领会；鉴别

sentences.english: Thanks ever so much for your help, I really appreciate it.
sentences.chinese: 多谢你的帮助，我真的很感激。

sentences.english: I appreciate your concern , but honestly, I’m fine.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢你关心，不过说真的，我很好。

sentences.english: I’d appreciate it if you let me get on with my job.
sentences.chinese: 如果你能让我继续工作，我会非常感激。

sentences.english: Her abilities are not fully appreciated by her employer.
sentences.chinese: 她的才干没有得到雇主的充分赏识。

sentences.english: I’m not an expert, but I appreciate fine works of art.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：我不是专家，但我欣赏优秀的艺术作品。

detailed_translations.english: used to thank someone in a polite way or to say that you are grateful for something they have done

name: acid
trans: adj. 酸的；讽刺的；刻薄的

sentences.english: sulphuric acid
sentences.chinese: 硫酸

sentences.english: a juicy apple with a slightly acid flavour
sentences.chinese: 一个多汁、略带酸味的苹果

sentences.english: I was expecting another of his acid remarks, but he remained silent.
sentences.chinese: 我等着他再说一句刻薄的话，但他不吭声了。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical substance that has a  pH  of less than 7. Strong acids can burn holes in material or damage your skin
having a sharp sour taste

name: attain
trans: vt. 达到，实现；获得；到达

sentences.english: More women are attaining positions of power.
sentences.chinese: 越来越多的女性获得要职。

detailed_translations.english: to succeed in achieving something after trying for a long time
to succeed in achieving something after trying for a long time

sentences.english: Women tend to attribute their success to external causes such as luck.
sentences.chinese: 女性往往把她们的成功归因于外因，如运气。

detailed_translations.english: If you attribute something to an event or situation, you think that it was caused by that event or situation
a quality or feature, especially one that is considered to be good or useful

name: anxiety
trans: n. 焦虑；渴望；挂念；令人焦虑的事

sentences.english: his feelings of anxiety
sentences.chinese: 他焦虑的心情

sentences.english: A high level of anxiety was created by the introduction of cameras into the factory.
sentences.chinese: 工厂安装了摄像头，这引起了工人的高度不安。

sentences.english: It can help if you discuss your anxieties with someone.
sentences.chinese: 与别人谈谈自己的忧虑会有帮助的。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being very worried about something

sentences.english: How could she abandon her own child?
sentences.chinese: 她怎么能抛弃自己的孩子呢？

detailed_translations.chinese: 离弃， 丢弃； 遗弃； 抛弃； 放弃
detailed_translations.english: to leave someone, especially someone you are responsible for

sentences.english: He passes the ball with unerring accuracy.
sentences.chinese: 他传球准确无误。

sentences.english: They questioned the accuracy of the information in the file.
sentences.chinese: 他们怀疑档案中信息的正确性。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being exact or correct; the ability to do sth skilfully without making mistakes

name: assign
trans: vt. 分配；指派；[计][数] 赋值
vi. 将财产过户（尤指过户给债权人）

sentences.english: How much time have you assigned for the meeting?
sentences.chinese: 你给这个会议定了多长时间？

detailed_translations.chinese: 指派， 分配； 布置； 指定
detailed_translations.english: to give someone a particular job or make them responsible for a particular person or thing

name: anticipate
trans: vt. 预期，期望；占先，抢先；提前使用

sentences.english: Sales are better than anticipated.
sentences.chinese: 销量比预期要好。

sentences.english: A good speaker is able to anticipate an audience’s needs and concerns.
sentences.chinese: 好的演讲者能够预先考虑到听众需要什么、关注什么。

sentences.english: Daniel was eagerly anticipating her arrival.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼尔热切地期待着她的到来。

detailed_translations.english: to expect that something will happen and be ready for it

sentences.english: Children under 14 must be accompanied by an adult.
sentences.chinese: 14岁以下儿童必须有成人陪同。

sentences.english: Wherever her husband went, she would accompany him.
sentences.chinese: 不论丈夫去哪里，她都陪伴左右。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陪同， 伴随； 为…伴奏
detailed_translations.english: to go somewhere with someone

sentences.english: A postmortem was ordered to try to ascertain the cause of death.
sentences.chinese: 下令验尸以查明死因。

detailed_translations.chinese: 弄清， 查明； 确定
detailed_translations.english: to find out something

sentences.english: ...the limits of the human auditory range.
sentences.chinese: …人类听觉范围的局限。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the ability to hear

name: accessible
trans: adj. 易接近的；可进入的；可理解的

sentences.english: The island is only accessible by boat.
sentences.chinese: 这个岛只有坐船才能到。

sentences.english: There is a church which is easily accessible from my home.
sentences.chinese: 有座教堂离我家很近。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易接近的；可进入的；可理解的
detailed_translations.english: a place, building, or object that is accessible is easy to reach or get into

name: approximate
trans: vt. 近似；使…接近；粗略估计

sentences.english: For each approximate solution of a parameterized problem, the app also displays the margin of error.
sentences.chinese: 对于每一个参数化问题的近似结果，这个程序也会显示误差的边界。

sentences.english: Until the versions released in 1995, chunks were left unsorted within bins, so that the best-fit strategy was only approximate .
sentences.chinese: 直到1995年发布的半本，块在箱子里还是未排序的，所以最佳适合策略还只是近似的。

sentences.english: The model downloaded to a smart phone finds an approximate solution for a new set of parameters by reference to the precomputed solutions.
sentences.chinese: 这个模型会被下载到智能手机上，通过引用预先计算好的结果来找到一个对应新的参数组的近似结果。

detailed_translations.english: to be close to a particular number
an approximate number, amount, or time is close to the exact number, amount etc, but could be a little bit more or less than it

name: assumption
trans: n. 假定；设想；担任；采取

sentences.english: You would be making an assumption that's not based on any fact that you could report.
sentences.chinese: 你会做出不以你能报道的任何事实为依据的一种假设。

detailed_translations.english: something that you think is true although you have no definite proof

name: bias
trans: n. 偏见；偏爱；斜纹；乖离率

sentences.english: Students were evaluated without bias.
sentences.chinese: 对学生的评估都是公正的。

detailed_translations.english: an opinion about whether a person, group, or idea is good or bad that influences how you deal with it

sentences.english: The new resort area has boosted tourism.
sentences.chinese: 新的度假区促进了旅游业的发展。

detailed_translations.chinese: 推动， 促进， 激励； 替…做广告， 宣扬； 提高， 使增长
detailed_translations.english: to increase or improve something and make it more successful
something that gives someone more confidence, or that helps something increase, improve, or become successful

name: bearing
trans: n. [机] 轴承；关系；方位；举止

sentences.english: learning to take a compass bearing
sentences.chinese: 学习用罗盘辨别方向

sentences.english: An oil seal was replaced, along with both front wheel bearings.
sentences.chinese: 换了一个油封和两个前轮轴承

detailed_translations.chinese: 方位；（机器的）承座；轴承；忍受
detailed_translations.english: a direction or angle that is shown by a  compass

name: conflict
trans: n. 冲突，矛盾；斗争；争执
vi. 冲突，抵触；争执；战斗

sentences.english: the threat of industrial conflict in the coalfields
sentences.chinese: 煤田发生劳资纠纷的风险

sentences.english: Marx points out the potential conflicts below the surface of society.
sentences.chinese: 马克思指出了隐藏在社会表层之下的潜在矛盾。

sentences.english: His views on the literal truth of the Bible brought him into conflict with other Christian leaders.
sentences.chinese: 他坚持《圣经》字面真理的观点使他与其他的基督教领袖发生了冲突。

sentences.english: Doctors exercise considerable power and often come into conflict with politicians.
sentences.chinese: 医生行使很大的权力，常常和政客们发生冲突。

sentences.english: a lawyer specializing in conflict resolution
sentences.chinese: 专门解决纠纷的律师

detailed_translations.english: a state of disagreement or argument between people, groups, countries etc

sentences.english: cognitive psychology
sentences.chinese: 认知心理学

detailed_translations.english: related to the process of knowing, understanding, and learning something

name: chronic
trans: adj. 慢性的；长期的；习惯性的

sentences.english: chronic arthritis
sentences.chinese: 慢性关节炎

sentences.english: chronic asthma
sentences.chinese: 慢性哮喘

sentences.english: chronic heart disease
sentences.chinese: 慢性心脏病

detailed_translations.english: a chronic disease or illness is one that continues for a long time and cannot be cured

sentences.english: a political controversy
sentences.chinese: 政治争议

sentences.english: the controversy surrounding Skinner’s theories
sentences.chinese: 围绕斯金纳的理论的争议

sentences.english: (= began ) over the use of the chemicals on crops.
sentences.chinese: 对庄稼施用化学品的做法引起了争论。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument about something that involves many people and continues for a long time

sentences.english: Languages are an essential part of the school curriculum.
sentences.chinese: 语言是学校课程中必不可少的部分。

sentences.english: curriculum planning
sentences.chinese: 课程安排

detailed_translations.english: the subjects that are taught by a school, college etc, or the things that are studied in a particular subject

sentences.english: She cannot comprehend the extent of the disaster.
sentences.chinese: 她无法理解这场灾难的严重程度。

sentences.english: I did not fully comprehend what had happened.
sentences.chinese: 我没有完全理解发生了什么事。

detailed_translations.english: to understand something that is complicated or difficult

sentences.english: We cultivated maize and watermelons.
sentences.chinese: 我们种植玉米和西瓜。

detailed_translations.english: to plant and take care of a particular crop

name: conceive
trans: vt. 怀孕；构思；以为；持有

sentences.english: He conceived the idea of transforming the old power station into an arts centre.
sentences.chinese: 他想出了一个把旧发电站改造为艺术中心的主意。

sentences.english: God is often conceived of as male.
sentences.chinese: 上帝常常被想象为男性。

sentences.english: She is unable to conceive.
sentences.chinese: 她不能怀孕。

sentences.english: Their first child was conceived on their wedding night.
sentences.chinese: 他们的第一个小孩是在新婚之夜怀上的。

detailed_translations.english: to form an idea, a plan, etc. in your mind; to imagine sth

name: collapse
trans: vt. 使倒塌，使崩溃；使萎陷；折叠

sentences.english: Uncle Ted’s chair collapsed under his weight.
sentences.chinese: 椅子承受不了特德叔叔的重量，塌架了。

sentences.english: The roof had collapsed long ago.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶早就塌了。

detailed_translations.english: if a building, wall etc collapses, it falls down suddenly, usually because it is weak or damaged

name: compound
trans: n. [化学] 化合物；混合物；复合词
v. 合成；混合；恶化，加重；和解，妥协

sentences.english: ...the big compound eyes of dragonflies.
sentences.chinese: …蜻蜓的大复眼。

detailed_translations.english: Compound is used to indicate that something consists of two or more parts or things
a substance containing atoms from two or more  elements

detailed_translations.chinese: 使恶化， 加重； 使化合， 使合成
detailed_translations.english: to make a difficult situation worse by adding more problems

sentences.english: Poor soil has constrained the level of crop production.
sentences.chinese: 贫瘠的土地限制了农作物的产量。

sentences.english: Women’s employment opportunities are often severely constrained by family commitments.
sentences.chinese: 女性的就业机会常常受到家庭责任的严重限制。

detailed_translations.english: to limit something

sentences.english: The problems confronting the new government were enormous.
sentences.chinese: 新政府面临的难题是巨大的。

sentences.english: I confronted him with my suspicions, and he admitted everything.
sentences.chinese: 我当面向他提出我的怀疑，他什么都承认了。

detailed_translations.english: (of problems or a difficult situation) to appear and need to be dealt with by sb

sentences.english: traditional rural crafts
sentences.chinese: 传统的乡村手工艺

sentences.english: arts and crafts
sentences.chinese: 手工艺

detailed_translations.english: a job or activity in which you make things with your hands, and that you usually need skill to do
to make something using a special skill, especially with your hands

name: convict
trans: vt. 证明…有罪；宣告…有罪

sentences.english: a convicted murderer
sentences.chinese: 已定罪的谋杀犯

sentences.english: an escaped convict
sentences.chinese: 越狱犯

detailed_translations.english: to prove or officially announce that someone is guilty of a crime after a trial in a law court
someone who has been proved to be guilty of a crime and sent to prison

name: campaign
trans: vi. 作战；参加竞选；参加活动

sentences.english: Jones ran a good campaign.
sentences.chinese: 琼斯的活动搞得很成功。

sentences.english: Police have launched a campaign to crack down on drug dealers.
sentences.chinese: 警方发起了一场严厉打击毒贩的运动。

detailed_translations.english: a series of actions intended to achieve a particular result relating to politics or business, or a social improvement

name: circumstance
trans: n. 环境，情况；事件；境遇

sentences.english: The Soviet Union had been forced by circumstances to sign a pact with Nazi Germany.
sentences.chinese: 苏联为形势所迫同纳粹德国签订了一项条约。

sentences.english: I can’t imagine a circumstance in which I would be willing to steal.
sentences.chinese: 我无法想象我在什么情况下会愿意去偷东西。

sentences.english: Grants are awarded according to your financial circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 补助金根据经济状况发给。

detailed_translations.english: the conditions that affect a situation, action, event etc

name: coin
trans: vt. 铸造（货币）；杜撰，创造

sentences.english: Toss a coin to see who goes first.
sentences.chinese: 抛硬币决定谁先来。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of metal, usually flat and round, that is used as money
to make pieces of money from metal

sentences.english: carved wooden chairs
sentences.chinese: 木雕椅子

sentences.english: Carve the meat into slices.
sentences.chinese: 把肉切成片。

detailed_translations.english: to make an object or pattern by cutting a piece of wood or stone

sentences.english: She stood nervously in the wings waiting for her cue.
sentences.chinese: 她紧张地站在台侧等待出场的提示。

detailed_translations.english: an action or event that is a signal for something else to happen
to give someone a sign that it is the right moment for them to speak or do something, especially during a performance

name: coincide
trans: vi. 一致，符合；同时发生
vi. (在性格、品质等方面)完全一致，相符

sentences.english: When our vacations coincided, we often holidayed together.
sentences.chinese: 我们的假期要是凑巧赶在一起，我们常常会一同去度假。

sentences.english: The interests of the US and those of the islanders may not coincide.
sentences.chinese: 美国的利益和这些岛民的利益可能并不一致。

detailed_translations.english: to happen at the same time as something else, especially by chance

name: correlate
trans: n. 相关物；相关联的人
vt. 使有相互关系；互相有关系

sentences.english: Obesity correlates with increased risk for hypertension and stroke.
sentences.chinese: 过度肥胖与高血压和中风的发病风险增加密切相关。

detailed_translations.english: if two or more facts, ideas etc correlate or if you correlate them, they are closely connected to each other or one causes the other
if two or more facts, ideas etc correlate or if you correlate them, they are closely connected to each other or one causes the other

name: comprehensive
trans: n. 综合学校；专业综合测验
adj. 综合的；广泛的；有理解力的

sentences.english: We offer our customers a comprehensive range of financial products.
sentences.chinese: 我们为客户提供全面的金融产品。

sentences.english: a comprehensive guide to British hotels and restaurants
sentences.chinese: 一本介绍英国酒店和餐厅的详尽指南

sentences.english: The following guidelines do not aim to be totally comprehensive.
sentences.chinese: 以下指导原则并非想要面面俱到。

detailed_translations.english: including all the necessary facts, details, or problems that need to be dealt with

sentences.english: the continents of Asia and Africa
sentences.chinese: 亚洲及非洲大陆

detailed_translations.english: a large mass of land surrounded by sea
able to control your sexual desires

sentences.english: Vigorous exercise increases oxygen consumption.
sentences.chinese: 剧烈运动增加氧的消耗。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of energy, oil, electricity etc that is used

sentences.english: the government’s promise to compensate victims of the flood
sentences.chinese: 政府对水灾灾民给予补偿的许诺

sentences.english: The firm will compensate workers for their loss of earnings.
sentences.chinese: 公司将补偿工人的收入损失。

detailed_translations.english: to pay someone money because they have suffered injury, loss, or damage

name: capable
trans: adj. 能干的，能胜任的；有才华的

sentences.english: I don’t think he’s capable of murder.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他没有能力杀人。

sentences.english: The company isn’t capable of handling an order that large.
sentences.chinese: 那家公司没有能力应付那么大的订单。

sentences.english: I’m perfectly capable of looking after myself, thank you!
sentences.chinese: 我完全能够自己照顾自己，多谢了！

detailed_translations.english: having the qualities or ability needed to do something

name: contemporary
trans: n. 同时代的人；同时期的东西
adj. 当代的；同时代的；属于同一时期的

sentences.english: She writes a lot of contemporary music for people like Whitney Houston.
sentences.chinese: 她为惠特尼·休斯敦等人创作大量当代音乐作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 现代的， 当代的； 同时代的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to the present time

name: curiosity
trans: n. 好奇，好奇心；珍品，古董，古玩

sentences.english: I opened the packet just to satisfy my curiosity .
sentences.chinese: 我打开包裹只是为了满足我的好奇心。

sentences.english: The news aroused a lot of curiosity among local people.
sentences.chinese: 这条消息在当地人中间引起了很大的好奇心。

sentences.english: She decided to follow him out of curiosity .
sentences.chinese: 她出于好奇决定跟踪他。

sentences.english: Margaret looked at him with curiosity .
sentences.chinese: 玛格丽特好奇地看着他。

sentences.english: a man of immense intellectual curiosity
sentences.chinese: 求知欲极强的一个男人

sentences.english: It was idle curiosity that made me ask.
sentences.chinese: 我只是好奇地随便问了一下。

detailed_translations.english: the desire to know about something

name: contradict
trans: vt. 反驳；否定；与…矛盾；与…抵触
vi. 反驳；否认；发生矛盾

sentences.english: Deborah opened her mouth to contradict, but closed it again.
sentences.chinese: 黛博拉张口想要反驳，但又把嘴闭上了。

sentences.english: Dad just can’t bear to be contradicted.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸就是受不了有人反驳他。

sentences.english: The article flatly contradicts their claims.
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章断然驳斥他们的说法。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with something, especially by saying that the opposite is true

sentences.english: All this information can be conveyed in a simple diagram.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些信息可以通过一张简单的图表来表示。

sentences.english: Ads convey the message that thin is beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 广告传递的信息是: 瘦就是美。

sentences.english: He was sent to convey a message to the UN Secretary General.
sentences.chinese: 他被派去向联合国秘书长传达一条信息。

detailed_translations.english: to communicate or express something, with or without using words

name: correspond
trans: vi. 符合，一致；相应；通信

sentences.english: The two halves of the document did not correspond.
sentences.chinese: 这份文件的前后两部分不相符。

sentences.english: The French ‘baccalauréate’ exam roughly corresponds to English A levels.
sentences.chinese: 法国的毕业会考大致相当于英国的高级程度考试。

detailed_translations.english: if two things or ideas correspond, the parts or information in one relate to the parts or information in the other

sentences.english: The party’s share of the electorate has diminished steadily.
sentences.chinese: 支持这个政党的选民比例持续下降。

sentences.english: These drugs diminish blood flow to the brain.
sentences.chinese: 这些药物会减少流向脑部的血液量。

detailed_translations.english: to become or make something become smaller or less

detailed_translations.chinese: 减少， 减小， 降低
detailed_translations.english: to become or make something become smaller or less

sentences.english: Mr. Ying is one of those happy people who derive pleasure from helping others.
sentences.chinese: 英先生是那种助人为乐的快活人。

detailed_translations.english: to get something, especially an advantage or a pleasant feeling, from something
to develop or come from something else

sentences.english: She was hit by flying debris from the blast.
sentences.chinese: 她被爆炸产生的飞散碎片击中。

detailed_translations.english: the pieces of something that are left after it has been destroyed in an accident, explosion etc

sentences.english: Mr. Ying is one of those happy people who derive pleasure from helping others.
sentences.chinese: 英先生是那种助人为乐的快活人。

detailed_translations.english: to get something, especially an advantage or a pleasant feeling, from something
to develop or come from something else

name: deforestation
trans: n. 采伐森林；森林开伐

sentences.english: the deforestation of the tropics
sentences.chinese: 热带森林的毁坏

detailed_translations.english: the cutting or burning down of all the trees in an area

sentences.english: ...a country where drought and famines have killed up to two million people during the last eighteen years.
sentences.chinese: …过去18年来干旱和饥荒致死达两百万人的一个国家。

detailed_translations.english: a long period of dry weather when there is not enough water for plants and animals to live

sentences.english: The city centre was devastated by the bomb.
sentences.chinese: 市中心被这枚炸弹摧毁了。

detailed_translations.english: to damage something very badly or completely

sentences.english: drastic cuts in government spending
sentences.chinese: 政府开支的急剧削减

sentences.english: Drastic changesare needed if environmental catastrophe is to be avoided.
sentences.chinese: 要想避免环境灾难就需要重大的变革。

detailed_translations.english: extreme and sudden

sentences.english: a book depicting life in pre-revolutionary Russia
sentences.chinese: 描写革命前俄国人生活的一本书

detailed_translations.english: to describe something or someone in writing or speech, or to show them in a painting, picture etc

name: dismiss
trans: vt. 解散；解雇；开除；让...离开；不予理会、不予考虑

sentences.english: He just laughed and dismissed my proposal as unrealistic.
sentences.chinese: 他只是笑了笑，认为我的建议不切实际，拒绝考虑。

sentences.english: Bryant was unfairly dismissed from his post.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩特被无理免职了。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to consider someone’s idea, opinion etc, because you think it is not serious, true, or important

name: dispute
trans: vt. 辩论；怀疑；阻止；抗拒

sentences.english: It is beyond dispute that advances in medicine have enabled people to live longer.
sentences.chinese: 医学的发展使人们更加长寿，这是无可置疑的。

sentences.english: What happened next is hotly disputed .
sentences.chinese: 关于后来发生了什么，争论很激烈。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument or disagreement
to argue or disagree with someone

name: desirable
trans: adj. 令人满意的；值得要的

sentences.english: The ability to speak a foreign language is highly desirable .
sentences.chinese: 能说一门外语是非常理想的。

sentences.english: a desirable neighborhood
sentences.chinese: 理想的社区

sentences.english: It is desirable that you should have some familiarity with computers.
sentences.chinese: 应该对电脑有所熟悉，这是很有益处的。

sentences.english: It is desirable to keep the cost as low as possible.
sentences.chinese: 把成本控制得越低越好。

detailed_translations.english: something that is desirable is worth having or doing

sentences.english: Try not to distract the other students.
sentences.chinese: 尽量不要让其他学生分心。

detailed_translations.english: to take someone’s attention away from something by making them look at or listen to something else

sentences.english: His account was badly distorted by the press.
sentences.chinese: 他的话被报界严重歪曲。

sentences.english: an expensive subsidy which distorts the market
sentences.chinese: 扰乱市场秩序的高价补贴

detailed_translations.english: to report something in a way that is not completely true or correct

sentences.english: Alison cleverly deduced that I was the author of the letter.
sentences.chinese: 艾莉森聪明地推断出我是这封信的作者。

detailed_translations.chinese: 推论， 推断， 演绎
detailed_translations.english: to use the knowledge and information you have in order to understand something or form an opinion about it

name: descend
trans: vi. 下降；下去；下来；遗传；屈尊

sentences.english: Our plane started to descend.
sentences.chinese: 我们的飞机开始下降。

sentences.english: I heard his footsteps descending the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 我听到他下楼的脚步声。

detailed_translations.english: to move from a higher level to a lower one
to move from a higher level to a lower one

name: duration
trans: n. 持续，持续的时间，期间

sentences.english: The course is of three years’ duration.
sentences.chinese: 该课程为期三年。

detailed_translations.english: the length of time that something continues

sentences.english: a ruthless dictator who eliminated all his rivals
sentences.chinese: 铲除所有异己的残酷独裁者

detailed_translations.english: to completely get rid of something that is unnecessary or unwanted

sentences.english: I couldn’t sleep for three days – I’m not exaggerating.
sentences.chinese: 我三天没睡觉了——一点不夸张。

detailed_translations.english: to make something seem better, larger, worse etc than it really is

sentences.english: A second excavation, in 1985, lasted a year and was cut short for technical reasons.
sentences.chinese: 第二次挖掘是在1985年，因为技术原因持续了一年就突然停止了。

sentences.english: If he thinks I’m particular about excavation records, you should see him taking pictures!
sentences.chinese: 如果他觉得我对挖掘纪录很挑剔，你应该看看他是怎么拍照的。

sentences.english: Blue flags define the excavation perimeter, while yellow ones mark the location of fossils or stone tools.
sentences.chinese: 蓝旗用来显示发掘地的周长，而黄旗用来标明发掘出化石或石制工具的地点。

sentences.english: The cliffs are being constantly eroded by heavy seas.
sentences.chinese: 悬崖正不断受到汹涌海浪的侵蚀。

sentences.english: The rocks have gradually eroded away.
sentences.chinese: 岩石逐渐风化。

detailed_translations.english: if the weather erodes rock or soil, or if rock or soil erodes, its surface is gradually destroyed

name: extinct
trans: adj. 灭绝的，绝种的；熄灭的

sentences.english: Dinosaurs have been extinct for millions of years.
sentences.chinese: 恐龙已灭绝数千万年了。

sentences.english: Pandas could become extinct in the wild.
sentences.chinese: 熊猫在野生环境中可能会绝种。

sentences.english: an extinct species
sentences.chinese: 已灭绝的一个物种

detailed_translations.english: (of a type of plant, animal, etc.) no longer in existence

sentences.english: The doctor had encountered several similar cases in the past.
sentences.chinese: 那位医生过去曾碰到过好几个类似病例。

detailed_translations.english: to experience something, especially problems or opposition
an occasion when you meet someone, or do something with someone you do not know

name: embark
trans: vi. 从事，着手；上船或飞机

sentences.english: He's embarking on a new career as a writer.
sentences.chinese: 他正开始一个当作家的新生涯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 上船； 着手， 开始工作
detailed_translations.english: to go onto a ship or a plane, or to put or take something onto a ship or plane

name: ethic
trans: adj. 伦理的；道德的（等于ethical）

sentences.english: The old ethic of hard work has given way to a new ethic of instant gratification.
sentences.chinese: 旧有的崇尚勤勉的道德观已被及时行乐的新观念所取代。

detailed_translations.english: a general idea or belief that influences people’s behaviour and attitudes

sentences.english: Good lighting will enhance any room.
sentences.chinese: 良好的照明能给房间增色不少。

sentences.english: The publicity has enhanced his reputation.
sentences.chinese: 这次宣传提高了他的声誉。

detailed_translations.english: to improve something

sentences.english: the problem of soil erosion
sentences.chinese: 水土流失的问题

sentences.english: the erosion of the coastline
sentences.chinese: 海岸线受到的侵蚀

detailed_translations.english: the process by which rock or soil is gradually destroyed by wind, rain, or the sea

name: emit
trans: vt. 发出，放射；发行；发表

sentences.english: The kettle emitted a shrill whistle.
sentences.chinese: 水壶发出了刺耳的鸣笛声。

detailed_translations.english: to send out gas, heat, light, sound etc

sentences.english: an expedition to the North Pole
sentences.chinese: 北极探险

sentences.english: another Qomolangma expedition
sentences.chinese: 又一次珠穆朗玛峰探险

detailed_translations.english: a long and carefully organized journey, especially to a dangerous or unfamiliar place, or the people that make this journey

name: exploit
trans: vt. 开发，开拓；剥削；开采

sentences.english: the urgent need to exploit the resources of the Irish Sea
sentences.chinese: 开发爱尔兰海资源的迫切需要

detailed_translations.english: to develop and use minerals, forests, oil etc for business or industry

name: essence
trans: n. 本质，实质；精华；香精

sentences.english: In essence his message was very simple.
sentences.chinese: 实质上他想表达的意思很简单。

detailed_translations.english: the most basic and important quality of something

name: entitle
trans: vt. 称做…；定名为…；给…称号；使…有权利

sentences.english: They understood that our power alone cannot protect us, nor does it entitle us to do as we please.
sentences.chinese: 他们懂得单凭实力无法保护我们的安全，实力也并不赋予我们随心所欲的权利。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone the official right to do or have something

sentences.english: Gillian and Darren greeted the speakers with great enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 吉利恩和达伦非常热情地接待了演讲者。

sentences.english: We went along to the local diving club, full of enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 我们兴高采烈地去了当地的潜水俱乐部。

sentences.english: They go about their tasks with little enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 他们执行任务时没多大干劲。

sentences.english: A delay of two hours did not dampen their enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 耽误了两小时没有减弱他们的热情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热情， 热心， 热忱； 巨大兴趣
detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of interest and enjoyment about something and an eagerness to be involved in it

name: esteem
trans: vt. 尊敬；认为；考虑；估价

sentences.english: Peden was greatly esteemed by the people of Ayrshire.
sentences.chinese: 佩登深受艾尔郡人的尊敬。

sentences.english: He was esteemed as a literary wit.
sentences.chinese: 他被尊为文学才子。

detailed_translations.english: to respect and admire someone or something

name: extract
trans: n. 汁；摘录；榨出物；选粹
vt. 提取；取出；摘录；榨取

sentences.english: You’ll have to have that tooth extracted.
sentences.chinese: 你得把那颗牙拔掉。

sentences.english: Oils are extracted from the plants.
sentences.chinese: 从这些植物中提炼出油。

sentences.english: I’ve only seen short extracts from the film.
sentences.chinese: 我只是看过那部电影的一些小片段。

detailed_translations.english: to remove an object from somewhere, especially with difficulty
a short piece of writing, music etc taken from a particular book, piece of music etc

name: elusive
trans: adj. 难懂的；易忘的；逃避的；难捉摸的

sentences.english: She enjoys a firm reputation in this country but wider international success has been elusive.
sentences.chinese: 她在这个国家享有稳固的声誉，但却一直难以在国际上取得更大的成功。

detailed_translations.chinese: 难懂的；易忘的；逃避的；难捉摸的
detailed_translations.english: an elusive result is difficult to achieve

name: exclusive
trans: n. 独家新闻；独家经营的项目；排外者
adj. 独有的；排外的；专一的

sentences.english: Bel Air is an exclusive suburb of Los Angeles.
sentences.chinese: 贝莱尔是洛杉矶郊外一处高级住宅区。

detailed_translations.chinese: 奢华的，高级的；独有的，独享的；排斥的，排他的；不包括…的，不把…计算在内的
detailed_translations.english: available or belonging only to particular people, and not shared
an important or exciting story that is printed in only one newspaper, because that newspaper was the first to find out about it

name: elaborate
trans: adj. 精心制作的；详尽的；煞费苦心的
vt. 精心制作；详细阐述；从简单成分合成（复杂有机物）

sentences.english: pure silks embroidered with elaborate patterns
sentences.chinese: 绣有精美图案的真丝衣服

sentences.english: A spokesman declined to elaborate on a statement released late yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 发言人拒绝对昨天晚些时候发表的一份声明作出更多说明。

detailed_translations.chinese: 复杂的； 精心制作的
detailed_translations.english: having a lot of small parts or details put together in a complicated way
If you elaborate on something that has been said, you say more about it, or give more details

name: external
trans: adj. 外部的；表面的；[药] 外用的；外国的；外面的

sentences.english: The open cities will be testing grounds for our external policies.
sentences.chinese: 使开放城市成为对外政策的窗口。

sentences.english: The ear canal also named middle ear splays out at the external position.
sentences.chinese: 耳道亦称中耳，内小外大呈喇叭状。

sentences.english: Riddled with a thousand gaping wounds, this reactionary clique is now beset with difficulties and contradictions both in internal and external affairs.
sentences.chinese: 今天， 这个反动集团百孔千疮， 内外交困， 矛盾重重。

name: flourish
trans: n. 兴旺；茂盛；挥舞；炫耀；华饰
vi. 繁荣，兴旺；茂盛；活跃；处于旺盛时期

sentences.english: He took his cap from under his arm with a flourish and pulled it low over his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他挥手从腋下取出帽子，拉低帽檐盖住眼睛。

sentences.english: He flourished the glass to emphasize the point.
sentences.chinese: 他挥舞着杯子来强调这一点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 兴旺；茂盛；挥舞；炫耀；华饰
detailed_translations.english: a curved line that you use to decorate writing
If you flourish an object, you wave it about in a way that makes people notice it

name: fragment
trans: n. 碎片；片断或不完整部分

sentences.english: glass fragments
sentences.chinese: 玻璃碎片

detailed_translations.chinese: 碎片；片断或不完整部分
detailed_translations.english: a small piece of something that has broken off or that comes from something larger
to break something, or be broken into a lot of small separate parts – used to show disapproval

name: fame
trans: n. 名声，名望；传闻，传说

sentences.english: He claims he is not really interested in fame.
sentences.chinese: 他称自己对出名真的没有兴趣。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being known about by a lot of people because of your achievements

name: fossil
trans: n. 化石；僵化的事物；顽固不化的人
adj. 化石的；陈腐的，守旧的

sentences.english: fossils of early reptiles
sentences.chinese: 早期爬行动物的化石

sentences.english: Marine sponges have a long fossil record (= their development has been recorded over a long period ).
sentences.chinese: 海绵动物留下了漫长的化石记录。

detailed_translations.english: an animal or plant that lived many thousands of years ago and that has been preserved, or the shape of one of these animals or plants that has been preserved in rock

name: fatigue
trans: vt. 使疲劳；使心智衰弱

sentences.english: She hoped to sleep off her fatigue.
sentences.chinese: 她希望睡一觉之后会消除疲劳。

sentences.english: I have got over my weakness and fatigue.
sentences.chinese: 我已从虚弱和疲劳中恢复过来了。

sentences.english: Everyone has analogy fatigue at this point.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上，人人都有类比疲劳。

detailed_translations.english: very great tiredness

name: gesture
trans: vi. 作手势；用动作示意

sentences.english: Jim raised his hands in a despairing gesture.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆举起双手，做出绝望的手势。

sentences.english: The Queen has now made a gesture towards public opinion.
sentences.chinese: 女王现在摆出了尊重民意的姿态。

detailed_translations.english: a movement of part of your body, especially your hands or head, to show what you mean or how you feel

name: heighten
trans: vt. 提高；增高；加强；使更显著

sentences.english: There are fears that the march will heighten racial tension.
sentences.chinese: 有人担心这次游行会加深种族间的紧张局势。

sentences.english: Increased levels of fat in the diet could heighten the risk of cancer.
sentences.chinese: 饮食中脂肪摄入量的提升会增加患癌症的风险。

detailed_translations.english: if something heightens a feeling, effect etc, or if a feeling etc heightens, it becomes stronger or increases

name: heritage
trans: n. 遗产；传统；继承物；继承权

sentences.english: the importance of preserving the national heritage
sentences.chinese: 保护民族遗产的重要性

sentences.english: beautiful old buildings which are part of our heritage
sentences.chinese: 属于我们遗产一部分的漂亮古建筑

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗产；传统；继承物；继承权
detailed_translations.english: the traditional beliefs, values, customs etc of a family, country, or society

name: harsh
trans: adj. 严厉的；严酷的；刺耳的；粗糙的；刺目的

sentences.english: The hostages are being held in harsh conditions.
sentences.chinese: 人质被拘押在恶劣环境中。

sentences.english: a young girl suddenly exposed to the harsh realities of life
sentences.chinese: 骤然暴露于残酷现实生活中的小女孩

detailed_translations.english: harsh conditions are difficult to live in and very uncomfortable

sentences.english: watching monkeys in their natural habitat
sentences.chinese: 观察自然生活环境中的猴子

sentences.english: The grassland is an important habitat for many wild flowers.
sentences.chinese: 这片草原是很多野花的重要生长地。

detailed_translations.english: the natural home of a plant or animal

name: harness
trans: n. 马具；甲胄；挽具状带子；降落伞背带；日常工作
vt. 治理；套；驾驭；披上甲胄；利用

sentences.english: We can harness the power of the wind to generate electricity.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以利用风力发电。

detailed_translations.english: to control and use the natural force or power of something

name: halt
trans: vi. 停止；立定；踌躇，犹豫

sentences.english: Heavy snowfalls brought traffic to a halt (= made it stop moving ).
sentences.chinese: 大雪使得交通陷于停顿。

sentences.english: The World Championship was brought to a temporary halt (= was stopped from continuing ).
sentences.chinese: 世界锦标赛暂停举行。

sentences.english: The President has called for a halt to the wave of emigration.
sentences.chinese: 总统呼吁遏制移民国外的热潮。

detailed_translations.english: a stop or pause
to prevent someone or something from continuing - used especially in news reports

sentences.english: Her instinct told her that something was wrong.
sentences.chinese: 直觉告诉她有些不对劲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 本能； 直觉， 生性
detailed_translations.english: a natural tendency to behave in a particular way or a natural ability to know something, which is not learned

sentences.english: the infancy of radio broadcasting
sentences.chinese: 无线电广播的初期阶段

detailed_translations.english: the period of a child’s life before they can walk or talk

name: infection
trans: n. 感染；传染；影响；传染病

sentences.english: The baby had an ear infection.
sentences.chinese: 宝宝耳朵感染了。

detailed_translations.english: a disease that affects a particular part of your body and is caused by bacteria or a virus

name: inherent
trans: adj. 固有的；内在的；与生俱来的，遗传的

sentences.english: Every business has its own inherent risks.
sentences.chinese: 每笔生意本身都有风险。

sentences.english: I’m afraid the problems you mention are inherent in the system.
sentences.chinese: 你提及的这些问题恐怕本来就存在于这个体制中。

detailed_translations.english: a quality that is inherent in something is a natural part of it and cannot be separated from it

name: inspire
trans: vt. 激发；鼓舞；启示；产生；使生灵感

sentences.english: We need someone who can inspire the team.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要一个能鼓舞团队士气的人。

sentences.english: Inspired by the sunny weather, I decided to explore the woods.
sentences.chinese: 阳光明媚的天气令人振奋，我决定到森林里寻幽探胜。

sentences.english: The story was inspired by a chance meeting with an old Russian duke.
sentences.chinese: 这个故事的创作灵感来自与一位俄国老公爵的不期而遇。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage someone by making them feel confident and eager to do something

name: implication
trans: n. 含义；暗示；牵连，卷入；可能的结果，影响

sentences.english: They are called ‘Supertrams’, the implication being that (= which is meant to suggest that ) they are more advanced than earlier models.
sentences.chinese: 它们被称作“超级电车”，这是暗指它们比先前的型号更先进。

detailed_translations.english: a suggestion that is not made directly but that people are expected to understand or accept

name: immense
trans: adj. 巨大的，广大的；无边无际的；非常好的

sentences.english: People who travel by rail still read an immense amount.
sentences.chinese: 人们坐火车旅行时仍然会读很多书。

sentences.english: Regular visits from a social worker can be of immense value to old people living alone.
sentences.chinese: 对于独居老人来说社工的经常探望很重要。

detailed_translations.english: extremely large

name: initiative
trans: adj. 主动的；自发的；起始的

sentences.english: I wish my son would show more initiative.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我的儿子能表现得再主动一些。

sentences.english: Don’t keep asking me for advice. Use your initiative.
sentences.chinese: 别老是要我给你出主意，发挥一下你自己的决断能力吧。

sentences.english: Lt. Carlos was not obeying orders. He acted on his own initiative (= he was not told what to do ).
sentences.chinese: 卡洛斯中尉没有服从命令，而是自作主张。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to make decisions and take action without waiting for someone to tell you what to do

name: intention
trans: n. 意图；目的；意向；愈合

sentences.english: They went into town with the intention of visiting the library.
sentences.chinese: 他们进了城，打算参观图书馆。

detailed_translations.english: a plan or desire to do something

sentences.english: My daughter-in-law said that I was interfering, but I was only trying to help.
sentences.chinese: 我的儿媳说我多管闲事，但我只是想帮忙。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately get involved in a situation where you are not wanted or needed

sentences.english: The illness had impaired his ability to think and concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病损害了他的思维能力和注意力。

detailed_translations.english: to damage something or make it not as good as it should be

sentences.english: government intervention to regulate prices
sentences.chinese: 政府介入控制物价

detailed_translations.english: the act of becoming involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens

sentences.english: a writer of great insight
sentences.chinese: 有深刻洞察力的作家

sentences.english: The book gives us fascinating insights into life in Mexico.
sentences.chinese: 这本书生动地表现了墨西哥的生活。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand and realize what people or situations are really like

sentences.english: He had a scholarly air and was an accomplished linguist.
sentences.chinese: 他有一种学者的风度，而且是个熟练掌握多国语言的人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who studies or teaches linguistics

sentences.english: The heavy rains and flooding killed scores of livestock.
sentences.chinese: 大雨和洪水淹死了许多家畜。

detailed_translations.english: animals such as cows and sheep that are kept on a farm

name: limb
trans: vt. 切断…的手足；从…上截下树枝

sentences.english: She would be able to stretch out her cramped limbs and rest for a few hours.
sentences.chinese: 她将可以伸开蜷缩的四肢，休息几个小时。

sentences.english: She sat on a limb of the tree and looked down.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：她坐在一根大树枝上往下看.

detailed_translations.english: an arm or leg

sentences.english: Using a seatbelt will reduce the likelihood of serious injury in a car accident.
sentences.chinese: 系安全带可以降低在车祸中受重伤的可能性。

detailed_translations.english: the degree to which something can reasonably be expected to happen

sentences.english: ...adverse meteorological conditions.
sentences.chinese: …不利的气象条件。

detailed_translations.english: Meteorological means relating to meteorology

sentences.english: A whale is a kind of mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸是一种哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The whale is a mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸鱼是哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The problem with that theory is that no other mammal has resorted to this method of cooling down.
sentences.chinese: 这一理论的问题在于，没有其他的哺乳动物采取了这种降低体温的方式。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal that drinks milk from its mother’s body when it is young. Humans, dogs, and whales are mammals.

name: marine
trans: adj. 船舶的；海生的；海产的；航海的，海运的
n. 海运业；舰队；水兵；（海军）士兵或军官

sentences.english: the enormous variety of marine life
sentences.chinese: 海洋生物繁多的种类

sentences.english: the effects of oil pollution on marine mammals
sentences.chinese: 石油污染对海洋哺乳动物的影响

sentences.english: marine biology
sentences.chinese: 海洋生物学

detailed_translations.english: relating to the sea and the creatures that live there

sentences.english: The feedback will be used to modify the course for next year.
sentences.chinese: 这些反馈意见将用于修改明年的课程。

sentences.english: The regulations can only be modified by a special committee.
sentences.chinese: 这些法规只能由特别委员会来修改。

detailed_translations.english: to make small changes to something in order to improve it and make it more suitable or effective

name: mortality
trans: n. 死亡数，死亡率；必死性，必死的命运

sentences.english: Mortality from heart disease varies widely across the world.
sentences.chinese: 心脏病死亡率世界各地差异很大。

detailed_translations.english: the number of deaths during a particular period of time among a particular type or group of people

name: military
trans: adj. 军事的；军人的；适于战争的

sentences.english: a military helicopter
sentences.chinese: 军用直升机

sentences.english: military equipment
sentences.chinese: 军事设备

sentences.english: The government has threatened to take military action if the rebels do not withdraw from the area.
sentences.chinese: 政府警告说，如果叛乱分子不从该地区撤出，就要采取军事行动。

sentences.english: The United States is prepared to use military force to achieve its aims.
sentences.chinese: 美国准备动用武力达成目的。

sentences.english: a raid by European military forces
sentences.chinese: 欧洲军事力量发动的袭击

detailed_translations.english: used by, involving, or relating to the army, navy, or airforce
the military forces of a country

name: municipal
trans: adj. 市政的，市的；地方自治的

sentences.english: the municipal waste dump
sentences.chinese: 城市垃圾场

sentences.english: municipal elections
sentences.chinese: 市级选举

detailed_translations.english: relating to or belonging to the government of a town or city

sentences.english: plants nurtured in the greenhouse
sentences.chinese: 在温室里培育的植物

detailed_translations.english: to feed and take care of a child or a plant while it is growing
the education and care that you are given as a child, and the way it affects your later development and attitudes

sentences.english: Joyce’s style of writing was a striking departure from the literary norm.
sentences.chinese: 乔伊斯的写作风格与传统的文学风格大相径庭。

detailed_translations.english: the usual or normal situation, way of doing something etc

name: navigate
trans: vt. 驾驶，操纵；使通过；航行于

sentences.english: The river is too dangerous to navigate.
sentences.chinese: 这河道太危险，不适宜航行。

detailed_translations.english: to sail along a river or other area of water

name: optimist
trans: n. 乐观主义者；乐天派

sentences.english: He’s an eternal optimist (= he always believes that good things will happen ).
sentences.chinese: 他是个永远的乐观主义者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who believes that good things will happen

name: orbit
trans: n. 轨道；眼眶；势力范围；生活常规

sentences.english: Mars and Earth have orbits which change with time.
sentences.chinese: 火星和地球的轨道随着时间而发生改变。

detailed_translations.english: the curved path travelled by an object which is moving around another much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc
to travel in a curved path around a much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc

name: overwhelming
trans: adj. 压倒性的；势不可挡的
v. 压倒；淹没（overwhelm的ing形式）；制服

sentences.english: There is overwhelming evidence that smoking damages your health.
sentences.chinese: 有难以辩驳的证据表明吸烟有损健康。

sentences.english: An overwhelming majority of the members were against the idea.
sentences.chinese: 占压倒性多数的成员反对这项主张。

sentences.english: The proposal has been given overwhelming support.
sentences.chinese: 这一提议得到了压倒性多数的支持。

sentences.english: The British Air Force succeeded despite overwhelming odds against them.
sentences.chinese: 英国空军虽然处境极为不利，但还是完成了任务。

detailed_translations.english: very large or greater, more important etc than any other

sentences.english: The tax puts obstacles in the way of companies trying to develop trade overseas.
sentences.chinese: 这项税收为想在海外发展贸易的公司设置了障碍。

sentences.english: Women still have to overcome many obstacles to gain equality.
sentences.chinese: 妇女要获得平等仍需克服重重障碍。

sentences.english: We want to remove all obstacles to travel between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们想要消除在这两个国家之间旅行的所有障碍。

sentences.english: the single biggest obstacle to a Conservative victory in the next election
sentences.chinese: 保守党在下一届大选中获胜的最大障碍

sentences.english: There are formidable obstacles on the road to peace.
sentences.chinese: 通往和平的道路上存在难以逾越的障碍。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes it difficult to achieve some­thing

name: organ
trans: n. [生物] 器官；机构；风琴；管风琴；嗓音

sentences.english: the liver, heart, and other internal organs
sentences.chinese: 肝脏、心脏及其他内脏器官

sentences.english: loss of blood flow to his vital organs
sentences.chinese: 他的生命器官供血不足

sentences.english: Extra doses of the hormone caused the animals’ reproductive organs to develop sooner than usual.
sentences.chinese: 额外使用激素使得这些动物的生殖器官比正常情况下发育得更快。

sentences.english: In Arizona, 480 people are waiting for organ transplants.
sentences.chinese: 亚利桑那州有480人在等待器官移植。

sentences.english: dying people who have agreed to be organ donors
sentences.chinese: 愿意捐献器官的垂死的病人

detailed_translations.english: a part of the body, such as the heart or lungs, that has a particular purpose

sentences.english: The front portion of the rocket breaks off.
sentences.chinese: 火箭的前部脱落了。

sentences.english: Do you have any children’s portions?
sentences.chinese: 你们有儿童餐吗？

detailed_translations.english: a part of something larger, especially a part that is different from the other parts

sentences.english: prehistoric burial grounds
sentences.chinese: 史前墓地

sentences.english: prehistoric animals
sentences.chinese: 史前动物

detailed_translations.english: relating to the time in history before anything was written down

name: predator
trans: n. [动] 捕食者；[动] 食肉动物；掠夺者

sentences.english: With no natural predators on the island, the herd increased rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 由于岛上没有天然食肉动物，牧群的数量迅速增加。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that kills and eats other animals

sentences.english: They sprinkled pesticide to bug the potatoes .
sentences.chinese: 他们喷撒杀虫剂给马铃薯除虫。

sentences.english: This resulted in the contamination of the bags used in that facility's fluid bed dryers with pesticide contamination.
sentences.chinese: 这导致了由于工厂的流体床干燥器被杀虫剂污染而把使用的包装袋污染。

sentences.english: Investigators in Japan have found punctures on the outside of at least one of the bags tied to the poisonings as well as traces of the pesticide.
sentences.chinese: 日本调查人员在其中至少一袋涉及中毒案的饺子的外包装袋上发现了刺孔以及杀虫剂的痕迹。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical substance used to kill insects and small animals that destroy crops

sentences.english: The prospect of marriage terrified Alice.
sentences.chinese: 想到要结婚，艾丽斯害怕极了。

sentences.english: I had no job, no education, and no prospects .
sentences.chinese: 我没有工作，没受过什么教育，前途渺茫。

detailed_translations.english: a particular event which will probably or definitely happen in the future – used especially when you want to talk about how you feel about it

name: paradox
trans: n. 悖论，反论；似非而是的论点；自相矛盾的人或事

sentences.english: The paradox is that fishermen would catch more fish if they fished less.
sentences.chinese: 悖论就是: 如果渔夫减少捕鱼，反而会打到更多的鱼。

detailed_translations.english: a statement that seems impossible because it contains two opposing ideas that are both true

sentences.english: the artist’s use of perspective
sentences.chinese: 那位画家对透视法的运用

sentences.english: a perspective of the whole valley
sentences.chinese: 山谷全景

sentences.english: His father’s death gave him a whole new perspective on life.
sentences.chinese: 父亲的死使他对生活有了全新的看法。

detailed_translations.english: a method of drawing a picture that makes objects look solid and shows distance and depth, or the effect this method produces in a picture

name: precede
trans: vt. 领先，在…之前；优于，高于

sentences.english: a type of cloud that precedes rain
sentences.chinese: 下雨前出现的一种云

sentences.english: Lunch will be preceded by a short speech from the chairman.
sentences.chinese: 午餐开始之前主席会发表一段简短的讲话。

sentences.english: The guard preceded them down the corridor.
sentences.chinese: 警卫带领他们穿过了走廊。

detailed_translations.english: to happen or exist before something or someone, or to come before something else in a series

sentences.english: an airline pilot
sentences.chinese: 航空公司飞行员

sentences.english: a fighter pilot
sentences.chinese: 战斗机驾驶员

sentences.english: The official report into the accident says that it was caused by pilot error (= a mistake by the pilot ) .
sentences.chinese: 那宗事故的官方报告称事故是由飞行员失误造成的。

sentences.english: The plan is to launch a pilot programme next summer.
sentences.chinese: 计划是在明年夏天实施一个试验性方案。

detailed_translations.english: someone who operates the controls of an aircraft or spacecraft
A pilot plan or a pilot project is one that is used to test an idea before deciding whether to introduce it on a larger scale
to guide an aircraft, spacecraft, or ship as its pilot

name: provision
trans: n. 规定；条款；准备；[经] 供应品
vt. 供给…食物及必需品

sentences.english: The agreement includes a provision for each side to check the other side’s weapons.
sentences.chinese: 协议有项规定，允许双方互查武器。

sentences.english: Under the provisions of the Act, employers must supply safety equipment.
sentences.chinese: 该法令规定，雇主必须提供安全设备。

detailed_translations.english: a condition in an agreement or law

name: persuade
trans: vt. 说服，劝说；使某人相信；劝某人做（不做）某事

sentences.english: He was fairly easily persuaded .
sentences.chinese: 他很轻易就被说服了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说服，劝说；使某人相信；劝某人做（不做）某事
detailed_translations.english: to make someone decide to do something, especially by giving them reasons why they should do it, or asking them many times to do it

name: plot
trans: vt. 密谋；绘图；划分；标绘

sentences.english: a two-acre plot of land
sentences.chinese: 一块两英亩的土地

sentences.english: a vegetable plot
sentences.chinese: 一块菜地

detailed_translations.english: a small piece of land for building or growing things on
to make a secret plan to harm a person or organization, especially a political leader or government

sentences.english: The physician examines the patient then diagnoses the disease and prescribes medication.
sentences.chinese: 内科医生检查了病人，然后对疾病作出诊断，并开出药方。

sentences.english: What punishment does the law prescribe for this crime?
sentences.chinese: 法律规定这种罪行应受何处罚？

detailed_translations.english: to say what medicine or treatment a sick person should have

name: purchase
trans: n. 购买；紧握；起重装置

sentences.english: She paid for her purchases and left.
sentences.chinese: 她付钱买好东西离开了。

sentences.english: I enclose my receipt as proof of purchase .
sentences.chinese: 我附上小票作为购物凭证。

sentences.english: She made two purchases from my stall.
sentences.chinese: 她从我的货摊上买了两样东西。

sentences.english: You can purchase insurance online.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在网上买保险。

detailed_translations.english: something you buy, or the act of buying it
to buy something

sentences.english: I was trying to think of some way to prolong the conversation.
sentences.chinese: 我在想方设法拖长这次谈话。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately make something such as a feeling or an activity last longer

name: proper
trans: adj. 适当的；本身的；特有的；正派的

sentences.english: It is right and proper that parents take responsibility for their children's attendance at school.
sentences.chinese: 父母负责督促子女上学上课，这是天经地义的事。

sentences.english: He is always perfectly proper in his behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为举止向来是无可挑剔的。

detailed_translations.english: socially and morally acceptable

sentences.english: a new drug that is in the experimental phase
sentences.chinese: 处于试验阶段的一种新药

sentences.english: It’s just a phase he’s going through.
sentences.chinese: 这只是他要经历的一个阶段。

detailed_translations.english: one of the stages of a process of development or change

name: permanent
trans: adj. 永久的，永恒的；不变的

sentences.english: He gave up a permanent job in order to freelance.
sentences.chinese: 他放弃了固定工作，为的是当一名自由职业者。

sentences.english: a permanent change in your eating habits
sentences.chinese: 饮食习惯的永久改变

sentences.english: The blindness that the disease causes will be permanent.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病引起的失明是永久性的。

sentences.english: Miller soon became a permanent fixture (= someone or something that is always there ) on the team.
sentences.chinese: 米勒很快就成为球队的固定队员。

detailed_translations.english: continuing to exist for a long time or for all the time in the future

name: productivity
trans: n. 生产力；生产率；生产能力

sentences.english: high productivity levels in manufacturing
sentences.chinese: 制造业中的高生产率

sentences.english: It cost the country $4 million in lost productivity .
sentences.chinese: 它对该国造成了400万美元的生产力损失。

detailed_translations.english: the rate at which goods are produced, and the amount produced, especially in relation to the work, time, and money needed to produce them

sentences.english: It’s amazing how closely Brian and Steve resemble each other.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩和史蒂夫真是惊人地相像。

sentences.english: He grew up to resemble his father.
sentences.chinese: 他长大了，很像他父亲。

detailed_translations.english: to look like or be similar to someone or something

name: rival
trans: vt. 与…竞争；比得上某人

sentences.english: This gives the company a competitive advantage over its rivals.
sentences.chinese: 这使该公司与其对手相比具有一项竞争优势。

sentences.english: He finished 39 seconds ahead of his main rival .
sentences.chinese: 他比主要对手早39秒到达终点。

sentences.english: She was 2 minutes faster than her nearest rival .
sentences.chinese: 她比紧随其后的对手快两分钟。

sentences.english: a game against their old rivals , Manchester United
sentences.chinese: 和他们的老对手曼联队的比赛

sentences.english: They still remain bitter rivals (= hate each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们仍是死敌。

sentences.english: Their sales have now overtaken those of their arch-rival (= main or strongest rival ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的销售额现已超过了主要竞争对手。

detailed_translations.english: a person, group, or organization that you compete with in sport, business, a fight etc

name: remote
trans: adj. 遥远的；偏僻的；疏远的

detailed_translations.english: far from towns or other places where people live

sentences.chinese: 你有权保留这些物品。

trans: n. 阻力；电阻；抵抗；反抗；抵抗力

sentences.english: His only recreations are drinking beer and watching football.
sentences.chinese: 他唯一的消遣就是喝啤酒和看足球比赛。

sentences.english: the provision of recreation facilities

detailed_translations.english: an activity that you do for pleasure or amusement

sentences.english: There were roughly 200 people there.
sentences.chinese: 那儿大约有200人。

name: sophisticate
trans: n. 久经世故的人；精通者
vt. 弄复杂；使变得世故；曲解

detailed_translations.chinese: 弄复杂；使变得世故；曲解

detailed_translations.english: someone who is sophisticated

sentences.chinese: 一台模拟太空环境的机器

trans: n. 怀疑论者；疑虑极深的人

sentences.chinese: 心脏病发作的一个征兆是左臂有刺痛感。

trans: adj. 壮观的，惊人的；公开展示的

sentences.chinese: 景色壮丽的山区

sentences.english: a spectacular success
sentences.chinese: 辉煌的成就

sentences.chinese: 场面盛大的电视节目

adj. 上级的；优秀的，出众的；高傲的

sentences.chinese: 她带着那种傲慢的语气。

trans: adj. 综合的；合成的，人造的

sentences.chinese: 合成化学品

detailed_translations.english: produced by combining different artificial substances, rather than being naturally produced

sentences.english: The uprising was ruthlessly suppressed.
sentences.chinese: 起义受到了残酷的镇压。

name: sensory
trans: adj. 感觉的；知觉的；传递感觉的

sentences.english: sensory deprivation

trans: n. 会议；（法庭的）开庭；（议会等的）开会；学期；讲习会

sentences.chinese: 委员会成员举行了闭门会议。

sentences.chinese: 该公司计划在西班牙设立办事处，以此增强在欧洲的实力。

sentences.chinese: 他瞄准目标，扣动了扳机。

sentences.chinese: 这次暗杀事件引发了一阵骚乱。

trans: n. 陆地生物；地球上的人

sentences.chinese: 有毒废料堆产生的毒气

sentences.chinese: 她竭力表现出平静的样子。

sentences.chinese: 她称赞丈夫给了她巨大支持。

sentences.english: Sales have been tremendous so far this year.

sentences.chinese: 审理定于下周开始。

sentences.chinese: 这个国家最近经历了巨大的变化。

sentences.chinese: 他获释出狱去美国接受治疗。

sentences.chinese: 她从星期一开始一直在接受各种检查。

sentences.chinese: 从美学角度看，这是个不错的设计。

sentences.chinese: 他环顾四周聚集的人群。

sentences.chinese: 我能向你保证，这文件是真的。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that something will definitely happen or is definitely true so that they are less worried

sentences.chinese: 计划的突然改变

sentences.chinese: 那位教授被指控剽窃学生的观点拿去发表。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you believe someone is guilty of a crime or of doing something bad

sentences.chinese: 票数有限，将分配给那些先申请的人。

sentences.chinese: 科学进步

detailed_translations.english: progress or development in your job, level of knowledge etc

sentences.chinese: 我以为身边的人抱怨是为了令我烦恼、是为了解决某些事、又或者他们就是喜欢抱怨。

sentences.english: The aircraft had reached its cruising altitude of about 39,000 feet.
sentences.chinese: 那架飞机已经达到了大约三万九千英尺的巡航高度。

sentences.english: In our case, we have found the true acoustic echo beacon.
sentences.chinese: 但在这种情况下，我们发现了真正的声学‘回声灯塔’ ”。

sentences.english: This gives it excellent thermal and acoustic properties, but the suitability of the product for a large-scale commercial project was questioned.
sentences.chinese: 这给了它出色的热学和声学属性，但是这种产品是否适合于一个大尺度的商业项目还是个问题。

detailed_translations.english: relating to sound and the way people hear things

name: acclaim
trans: vt. 称赞；为…喝彩，向…欢呼

sentences.english: His work was acclaimed by art critics.
sentences.chinese: 他的作品得到艺术评论家的推崇。

sentences.english: Angela Bassett has won critical acclaim for her excellent performance.
sentences.chinese: 安杰拉·巴西特因她出色的表演而赢得了评论界的赞扬。

detailed_translations.english: to praise someone or something publicly
Acclaim is public praise for someone or something

name: burgeoning
trans: adj. 增长迅速的；生机勃勃的
v. 成长（burgeon的ing形式）；迅速发展

sentences.english: The state had no choice but to accept the reality of burgeoning farmers’ markets and private trade.
sentences.chinese: 国家别无他法，唯有接受增长迅速的农民市场与私营交易这个现实。
