sentences.chinese: 有一群对装饰和点缀很感兴的年轻建筑师的迅速成长，但是他们是那种数字化和未来派的。

sentences.english: The buildings reflect the elegance of a bygone era.
sentences.chinese: 这些建筑物反映了过去年代的典雅。

detailed_translations.english: a period of time in the past

name: beforehand
trans: adj. 提前的；预先准备好的

sentences.english: The police need to be briefed beforehand on how to deal with this sort of situation.
sentences.chinese: 需要事先告诉警察这种情况怎样处理。

sentences.english: When you give a speech, it’s natural to feel nervous beforehand.
sentences.chinese: 你在演讲之前感到紧张是很自然的。

detailed_translations.english: before something else happens or is done

sentences.english: a bilingual dictionary
sentences.chinese: 双语词典

sentences.english: The report proposed bilingual education in schools.
sentences.chinese: 报告建议在学校中实行双语教学。

detailed_translations.english: written or spoken in two languages

sentences.english: measures to curb the spread of the virus
sentences.chinese: 控制病毒扩散的措施

detailed_translations.english: to control or limit something in order to prevent it from having a harmful effect

detailed_translations.chinese: 控制， 约束； 路缘
detailed_translations.english: an influence which helps to control or limit something

name: catastrophic
trans: adj. 灾难的；悲惨的；灾难性的，毁灭性的

sentences.english: A tidal wave caused by the earthquake hit the coast causing catastrophic damage.
sentences.chinese: 地震引发的海啸袭击了海岸，造成了灾难性的损失。

sentences.english: The water shortage in this country is potentially catastrophic.
sentences.chinese: 该国水资源的匮乏很可能是灾难性的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 灾难的；悲惨的；灾难性的，毁灭性的

sentences.english: In the case of this battle, the combat did only last a singleday.
sentences.chinese: 在译成战役的情况下，这场战斗仅仅持续了短短的一天。

sentences.english: We will remove our combat brigades from Iraq by the end of next summer, and all of our troops by the end of 2011.
sentences.chinese: 我们会在明年夏末从伊拉克撤回我们的战斗旅，在2011年末，我们所有军队都将从伊拉克撤出。

sentences.english: These people would then be given training in vigilance and combat not just to defend themselves but also the borders.
sentences.chinese: 这些人会被提供警戒和战斗训练，不仅是为了保护自己，而且要保护边界安全。

sentences.english: At a summer job working as park naturalists that year, I flipped the canoe Air and I were paddling and we had to push it to shore.
sentences.chinese: 那年我在公园里做暑期兼职，我把独木舟翻转个身，然后我们一起合力将它推到岸边，这样我们就可以划船了。

sentences.english: I remember the first time I visited a village in Vietnam, in 1995: we endured hours and hours of rutty roads or long hours in a canoe to reach project sites.
sentences.chinese: 我记得1995年第一次访问越南一个村落，我们捱过很多小时的路途颠簸、坐了很多小时的独木舟，才到达项目的所在地。

trans: vi. 处理；安排；（能够）决定

sentences.chinese: 埃塞尔的健康状况恶化了。

sentences.chinese: 处于同一人口统计细分的人们，可能具有不同的消费心态特征。

sentences.chinese: 组织通常通过包含了可能对主要产品或服务的市场营销产生影响的人口统计信息的列表或包括来研究或划分它的。

sentences.chinese: 她的尸体被发现丢在离她家不到一英里的一座废弃的仓库里。

sentences.english: Be explicit when you talk about money with your family.

sentences.chinese: 昆虫的数量每年变化很大。

sentences.chinese: 为什么美国人要把如此大量的时间、金钱、水、化肥和燃料花在一大片平整却毫无用处的草地上呢？

sentences.english: At the moment we are losing our groundwater very quickly, destroying soil nutrients, and farmers are going into debt because they are dependent on fertiliser and other inputs.
sentences.chinese: 目前，我们正在非常迅速地失去我们的地下水、破坏土壤养分，而农民们正在欠债，因为他们依赖于化肥和其它投入。

sentences.chinese: 你的个人物品我们将以空运方式运送，家具将以海运方式运送。

sentences.chinese: 《墨西哥玫瑰》的精彩和声演唱

sentences.chinese: 三部和声

sentences.chinese: 把所有食材都放在一个大碗里。

sentences.chinese: 继承的财富

sentences.chinese: 如果你有失眠症，试试我的简单疗法。

sentences.chinese: 在我失眠的时候，你要抱着我睡。

sentences.chinese: 该话题本身的趣味

sentences.chinese: 给最优秀的队发一瓶香槟作为额外的鼓励。

sentences.chinese: 我下车查看损坏情况。

sentences.english: Police inspected the scene and interviewed all the staff.
sentences.chinese: 警察仔细检查了现场并询问了所有员工。

sentences.chinese: 儿童学习语言的能力是与生俱来的。

trans: n. 免疫力；豁免权；免除

sentences.english: To protect you against small pox or diphtheria, you are vaccinated with a small amount of the toxin, and then your body develops immunity against that toxin.
sentences.chinese: 为了避免你长小脓包或得白喉病，所以会给你的身体接种小量毒素，然后你的身体会针对这些毒素产生免疫力。

sentences.english: Very few people will have any immunity to this particular combination, which is what gives the concern that this will be a pandemic rather than just a normal seasonal flu outbreak.
sentences.chinese: 因为很少有人具备对这种特别的混合病毒的免疫力。 人们因此担心，这将不仅仅是正常的季节性流感疫情，而是一次传染病的大流行。

sentences.english: But a new study shows that people with true expertise in a subject have some immunity to the siren song of corporate sponsorship.
sentences.chinese: 一项新的研究发现，在某一方面有真才实学的人们对广告赞助商的“糖衣炮弹”有一定的免疫力。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being immune to a disease

name: imperative
trans: n. 必要的事；命令；需要；规则；[语]祈使语气

sentences.english: It is imperative that politicians should be good communicators.
sentences.chinese: 政治家应该是很好的沟通者，这很重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 必要的；紧急的，极重要的；命令的

detailed_translations.english: something that must be done urgently

name: invasion

sentences.english: the invasion of Normandy
sentences.chinese: 对诺曼底的入侵

detailed_translations.english: when the army of one country enters another country by force, in order to take control of it

sentences.english: The remake of ‘Casablanca’ was a pale imitation (= something that is much less good than the thing it imitates ) of the original movie.
sentences.chinese: 重拍的《卡萨布兰卡》远不如原版。

sentences.english: ...a complete set of Dickens bound in imitation leather.
sentences.chinese: …用人造革装帧的一整套《狄更斯全集》。

detailed_translations.english: when you copy someone else’s actions
Imitation things are not genuine but are made to look as if they are

name: moderately
trans: adv. 适度地；中庸地；有节制地

sentences.chinese: 他喝酒有节制。

name: mundane
trans: adj. 世俗的，平凡的；世界的，宇宙的

sentences.english: Initially, the work was pretty mundane.
sentences.chinese: 刚开始，这工作非常乏味。

sentences.english: The mundane task of setting the table can be fun on holidays.
sentences.chinese: 摆放餐具这种无趣的事情在假日里也会变得有意思起来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 世俗的，平凡的；世界的，宇宙的
detailed_translations.english: ordinary and not interesting or exciting

name: mercy
trans: n. 仁慈，宽容；怜悯；幸运；善行

sentences.english: He showed no mercy to his enemies.
sentences.chinese: 他对敌人毫不仁慈。

sentences.english: God have mercy on his soul.
sentences.chinese: 愿上帝宽恕他的灵魂。

detailed_translations.english: if someone shows mercy, they choose to forgive or to be kind to someone who they have the power to hurt or punish

name: moist
trans: adj. 潮湿的；多雨的；含泪的

sentences.english: Make sure the soil is moist before planting the seeds.
sentences.chinese: 播种之前要确保土壤湿润。

sentences.english: a rich, moist chocolate cake
sentences.chinese: 香浓软润的巧克力蛋糕

sentences.english: warm moist air
sentences.chinese: 温暖湿润的空气

sentences.english: Her eyes were moist (= she was almost crying ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的眼睛湿润了。

detailed_translations.english: slightly wet, especially in a way that is pleasant or suitable

sentences.english: His relations with colleagues, differences of opinion notwithstanding, were unfailingly friendly.
sentences.chinese: 他与同事们尽管有意见分歧，但关系一直很融洽。

detailed_translations.english: Notwithstanding is also an adverb
in spite of something

sentences.english: The region was extremely beautiful. Nonetheless Gerard could not imagine spending the rest of his life there.
sentences.chinese: 那个地区非常漂亮，然而杰拉德却无法想象自己要在那里度过余生。

sentences.english: The paintings are complex, but have plenty of appeal nonetheless.
sentences.chinese: 这些画复杂难懂，不过还是不乏吸引力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 尽管如此， 依然， 然而

name: novelty
trans: n. 新奇；新奇的事物；新颖小巧而廉价的物品

sentences.english: Many toys have no attraction beyond their novelty value.
sentences.chinese: 许多玩具除了有些新奇感之外，别无吸引力。

sentences.english: Then the Internet was still something of a novelty.
sentences.chinese: 那时因特网还是个挺新鲜的东西。

name: outweigh
trans: vt. 比…重（在重量上）；比…重要；比…有价值

sentences.english: The advantages of this deal largely outweigh the disadvantages.

detailed_translations.english: If one thing outweighs another, the first thing is of greater importance, benefit, or significance than the second thing

name: offense
trans: n. 犯罪，过错；进攻；触怒；引起反感的事物

sentences.english: His solicitor said he committed the offence because he was heavily in debt.
sentences.chinese: 他的律师说他犯罪是因为欠下巨债。

sentences.english: Don’t be upset by what he said; he meant no offence (= did not intend to offend anyone ).
sentences.chinese: 不要为他的话而生气，他并没有冒犯谁的意思。

detailed_translations.english: an illegal action or a crime

sentences.english: the faint odour of damp
sentences.chinese: 一丝潮湿的气味

detailed_translations.english: a smell, especially an unpleasant one

name: persistent
trans: adj. 固执的，坚持的；持久稳固的

sentences.english: persistent rumours
sentences.chinese: 持续流传的谣言

sentences.english: persistent headaches
sentences.chinese: 持续头疼

sentences.english: a persistent problem
sentences.chinese: 长期问题

sentences.english: persistent rain
sentences.chinese: 连绵的雨

detailed_translations.english: continuing to exist or happen, especially for longer than is usual or desirable

name: propeller
trans: n. [航][船] 螺旋桨；推进器

sentences.english: ...a fixed three-bladed propeller.
sentences.chinese: …一个固定的三叶螺旋桨。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment consisting of two or more blades that spin around, which makes an aircraft or ship move

name: platform
trans: n. 平台；月台，站台；坛；讲台

sentences.english: The Edinburgh train will depart from platform six.
sentences.chinese: 开往爱丁堡的火车将从六号站台发车。

sentences.english: a small raised platform at one end of the room
sentences.chinese: 房间一端凸起的小讲台

sentences.english: an oil exploration platform
sentences.chinese: 石油勘探平台

detailed_translations.english: the raised place beside a railway track where you get on and off a train in a station

name: patent
trans: n. 专利权；执照；专利品
adj. 专利的；新奇的；显然的
vt. 授予专利；取得…的专利权

sentences.english: a patent lock
sentences.chinese: 专利锁

sentences.english: He held a number of patents for his many innovations.
sentences.chinese: 他为他的许多革新申请了几项专利。

detailed_translations.english: protected by a patent
A patent is an official right to be the only person or company allowed to make or sell a new product for a certain period of time.

name: pedestrian
trans: adj. 徒步的；缺乏想像力的

sentences.english: More than a third of all pedestrian injuries are to children.
sentences.chinese: 所有受伤的行人中有1/3以上是儿童。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is walking, especially along a street or other place used by cars

name: portrait
trans: n. 肖像；描写；半身雕塑像

sentences.english: a family portrait
sentences.chinese: 全家福

sentences.english: She’s been commissioned to paint Jackson’s portrait .
sentences.chinese: 她已受托为杰克逊画肖像。

detailed_translations.english: a painting, drawing, or photograph of a person

sentences.english: periodic home visits by nurses
sentences.chinese: 护士的定期上门探访

detailed_translations.english: happening a number of times, usually at regular times

name: publicity
trans: n. 宣传，宣扬；公开；广告；注意

sentences.english: Much advance publicity was given to the talks.
sentences.chinese: 会谈之前做了大量的宣传。

sentences.english: ...government publicity campaigns.
sentences.chinese: …政府的宣传活动。

detailed_translations.english: Publicity is information or actions that are intended to attract the public's attention to someone or something

name: pitfall
trans: n. 陷阱，圈套；缺陷；诱惑

sentences.english: the pitfalls associated with the purchase of a used car
sentences.chinese: 购买旧车时可能遇到的圈套

detailed_translations.english: a problem or difficulty that is likely to happen in a particular job, course of action, or activity

name: precipitation
trans: n. [化学] 沉淀，[化学] 沉淀物；降水；冰雹；坠落；鲁莽

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 沉淀，[化学] 沉淀物；降水；冰雹；坠落；鲁莽
detailed_translations.english: rain, snow etc that falls on the ground, or the amount of rain, snow etc that falls

name: plague
trans: n. 瘟疫；灾祸；麻烦；讨厌的人
vt. 折磨；使苦恼；使得灾祸

sentences.english: Financial problems continued to plague the company.
sentences.chinese: 资金问题持续困扰着该公司。

detailed_translations.english: to cause pain, suffering, or trouble to someone, especially for a long period of time

name: prohibitive
trans: adj. 禁止的，禁止性的；抑制的；（费用，价格等）过高的；类同禁止的

sentences.english: prohibitive regulations
sentences.chinese: 禁律

detailed_translations.chinese: 禁止的，禁止性的；抑制的；（费用，价格等）过高的；类同禁止的
detailed_translations.english: a prohibitive rule prevents people from doing things

name: praise
trans: n. 赞扬；称赞；荣耀；崇拜

sentences.english: It’s important to give children plenty of praise and encouragement.
sentences.chinese: 对小孩子多加表扬和鼓励是很重要的。

sentences.english: Her teacher was full of praise for her work.
sentences.chinese: 老师对她的作业赞不绝口。

sentences.english: His first novel received high praise .
sentences.chinese: 他的第一部小说受到了高度赞扬。

sentences.english: Gregory was singled out (= he was chosen in particular ) for special praise .
sentences.chinese: 格雷戈里被单独给予特别表扬。

sentences.english: The film has won praise from audiences and critics alike.
sentences.chinese: 那部电影赢得了观众和评论家的一致赞誉。

sentences.english: Jane was praised by her teacher.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：简受到了老师的表扬。

detailed_translations.english: words that you say or write in order to praise someone or something
to say that you admire and approve of someone or something, especially publicly

sentences.english: Where do you get your protein?
sentences.chinese: 你从哪里获得蛋白质？

sentences.english: Dairy source of protein and calcium.
sentences.chinese: 奶牛的蛋白质来源和钙。

sentences.english: So, what happens, this is another view of a sodium channel, so this is actually looking a little bit more at the protein structure .
sentences.chinese: 那么，这里发生了什么，这是钠离子通道的另一张图片，在这种蛋白质结构中，它看起来更复杂一点。

detailed_translations.english: one of several natural substances that exist in food such as meat, eggs, and beans, and which your body needs in order to grow and remain strong and healthy

name: redundant
trans: adj. 多余的，过剩的；被解雇的，失业的；冗长的，累赘的

sentences.english: Seventy factory workers were made redundant in the resulting cuts.
sentences.chinese: 在继而发生的裁员中，70名工厂工人被解雇。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过剩的；失业的，被解雇的
detailed_translations.english: if you are redundant, your employer no longer has a job for you

name: reluctant
trans: adj. 不情愿的；勉强的；顽抗的

sentences.english: She gave a reluctant smile.
sentences.chinese: 她勉强笑了笑。

detailed_translations.english: slow and unwilling

sentences.english: a dinner reservation
sentences.chinese: 预订晚餐

sentences.english: Customers are advised to make seat reservations well in advance.
sentences.chinese: 建议顾客提前订座。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement which you make so that a place in a hotel, restaurant, plane etc is kept for you at a particular time in the future

name: rudimentary
trans: adj. 基本的；初步的；退化的；残遗的；未发展的

sentences.english: Gradually, I acquired a rudimentary knowledge of music.
sentences.chinese: 我逐渐掌握了基本的音乐知识。

sentences.english: my rudimentary German
sentences.chinese: 我粗浅的德语

detailed_translations.chinese: 基本的；初步的；退化的；残遗的；未发展的
detailed_translations.english: a rudimentary knowledge or understanding of a subject is very simple and basic

sentences.english: I think we can all appreciate the relevance of that now.
sentences.chinese: 我想，我们大家现在都能领会这句话中肯。

sentences.english: Children used to learn by repetition.
sentences.chinese: 过去小孩子是通过背诵来学习的。

detailed_translations.english: doing or saying the same thing many times

name: spontaneous
trans: adj. 自发的；自然的；无意识的

sentences.english: The crowd gave a spontaneous cheer.
sentences.chinese: 人群自发地欢呼起来。

sentences.english: My spontaneous reaction was to run away.
sentences.chinese: 我的本能反应就是逃跑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 自发的， 无意识的； 自然的， 天真率直的
detailed_translations.english: something that is spontaneous has not been planned or organized, but happens by itself, or because you suddenly feel you want to do it

name: suburban
trans: adj. 郊区的，城郊的；土气的；见闻不广的

sentences.english: a quiet, suburban street
sentences.chinese: 一条安静的郊区街道

detailed_translations.chinese: 郊区的，城郊的；土气的；见闻不广的
detailed_translations.english: related to a suburb, or in a suburb

sentences.english: Narcissists aren't just attractive to themselves. They are, at least superficially, attractive to other people.
sentences.chinese: 自恋者不只是对自己有吸引力。至少从表面上看，他们对其他人也有吸引力。

sentences.english: Chairman Mao famously declared that women hold up half the sky and, superficially at least, went about promoting women into jobs previously designated to men.
sentences.chinese: 毛主席曾宣称，“妇女能顶半边天”，至少在表面上，促使女性进入了以前只有男人才能干的岗位。

sentences.english: She refused to speculate.
sentences.chinese: 她拒绝猜测。

detailed_translations.english: to guess about the possible causes or effects of something, without knowing all the facts or details

name: stride
trans: vt. 跨过；大踏步走过；跨坐在…

sentences.english: He strode toward her.
sentences.chinese: 他大步向她走去。

sentences.english: Paco reached the door in only three strides.
sentences.chinese: 帕科三大步就走到了门口。

detailed_translations.english: to walk quickly with long steps
a long step you make while you are walking

sentences.english: The desire for peace transcended political differences.
sentences.chinese: 对和平的渴望超越了政治分歧。

detailed_translations.english: to go beyond the usual limits of something

name: territory
trans: n. 领土，领域；范围；地域；版图

sentences.english: Hong Kong is a Chinese territory.
sentences.chinese: 香港是中国的领土。

sentences.english: The company is moving into unfamiliar territory with this new software.
sentences.chinese: 该公司正通过这种新软件进入一个不熟悉的领域。

detailed_translations.english: land that is owned or controlled by a particular country, ruler, or military force

name: tolerance
trans: n. 公差；宽容；容忍；公差

sentences.english: ...his tolerance and understanding of diverse human nature.
sentences.chinese: …他对各种人性的宽容和理解。

detailed_translations.english: willingness to allow people to do, say, or believe what they want without criticizing or punishing them

name: tackle
trans: n. 滑车；装备；用具；扭倒
vt. 处理；抓住；固定；与…交涉

sentences.english: There is more than one way to tackle the problem.
sentences.chinese: 解决这个问题不止一个办法。

sentences.english: fishing tackle
sentences.chinese: 渔具

detailed_translations.english: to try to deal with a difficult problem
the equipment used in some sports and activities, especially fishing

name: viable
trans: adj. 可行的；能养活的；能生育的

sentences.english: viable seeds
sentences.chinese: 可存活的种子

detailed_translations.chinese: 可行的；能养活的；能生育的
detailed_translations.english: a viable idea, plan, or method can work successfully

name: venue
trans: n. 审判地；犯罪地点；发生地点；集合地点

sentences.english: The first thing to do is book a venue.
sentences.chinese: 首先要做的是预订一个会场。

sentences.english: The band will play (= perform at ) as many venues as possible.
sentences.chinese: 那支乐队将在尽可能多的地方演出。

detailed_translations.english: a place where an organized meeting, concert etc takes place
someone who makes long and often dangerous journeys, especially on the sea

sentences.english: The stolen car was found in the vicinity of the station.
sentences.chinese: 被盗汽车在车站附近被发现。

sentences.english: There used to be a mill in the vicinity.
sentences.chinese: 附近曾有一座磨坊。

detailed_translations.english: in the area around a particular place
